title: How to Look Naturally Pretty & Radiate Beauty from the Inside Out

steps.title: This keeps skin healthy and helps prevent clogged pores and acne.
steps.content: This keeps skin healthy and helps prevent clogged pores and acne. For a naturally glowing complexion, it’s important to remove dirt, sweat, and dead skin from your skin’s surface each day. Wash your face with lukewarm water and a gentle cleanser in the morning and evening. Rinse with lukewarm water and pat your face dry with a soft towel. [1] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Wash your face as soon as possible after exercising or getting sweaty. Avoid harsh cleansers with alcohol in them. If you have sensitive or acne-prone skin, stick with fragrance-free and non-comedogenic products. [2] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Exfoliating removes dead skin so your face looks fresh and bright.
steps.content: Exfoliating removes dead skin so your face looks fresh and bright. The easiest way to exfoliate is with a face scrub ! Wet your face and apply the scrub using small, circular motions. After 30 seconds, rinse your face with lukewarm water and pat it dry with a clean towel. [3] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Alternatively, use a chemical exfoliant to improve skin tone and texture. Follow the directions of your specific product closely to avoid a burn. [4] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Exfoliating too often or too vigorously can irritate your skin. If you have sensitive skin, exfoliate once or twice a week. [5] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Never exfoliate your skin if you have open cuts or a sunburn.

steps.title: Moisturizing your skin keeps it supple, youthful, and soft.
steps.content: Moisturizing your skin keeps it supple, youthful, and soft. According to FAAD board certified dermatologist Mohiba Tareen, MD, “the best time to apply moisturizer is after showering or bathing.” [6] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020. Use your fingers to massage a non-comedogenic moisturizer into your skin. Gently pat your skin to help the moisturizer sink in, and be extra careful around your eye area since the skin is thinner. [7] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Give the moisturizer a few minutes to soak in before applying makeup or other skincare products. If you have dry skin, Tareen recommends using “a ceramide-based moisturizer ” to “help the skin hold onto moisture.” [8] X Expert Source Mohiba Tareen, MD FAAD Board Certified Dermatologist Expert Interview. 26 March 2020. If you have acne-prone skin, you might be tempted to skip moisturizer, but dry skin can make your acne worse. As long as you're using an oil-free and non-comedogenic moisturizer, you’ll be fine. [9] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source

steps.title: Brightening your smile is an easy way to enhance your natural beauty.
steps.content: Brightening your smile is an easy way to enhance your natural beauty. There are lots of teeth-whitening products out there, so start with a whitening toothpaste and see how that works for you. For quicker results, opt for whitening strips or at-home whitening trays . They usually have higher concentrations of hydrogen peroxide to lighten your teeth. You can always visit your dentist for a professional whitening treatment for more dramatic results. [10] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Look for whitening products that have earned the ADA Seal of Acceptance (the seal will be on the packaging). These are certified to be safe and effective. [11] X Research source Avoid coffee, tea, red wine, soda, and acidic foods (like oranges, strawberries, and tomatoes) immediately after whitening. They can stain your teeth. [12] X Research source If you have sensitive teeth, talk with your dentist before trying any at-home whitening products. They can tell you which products work best for you and offer other suggestions. [13] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: You will look and feel more confident!
steps.content: You will look and feel more confident! Smiling helps you look friendly and approachable to others. Plus, studies show that it can make you appear more trustworthy and intelligent! [14] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Proper posture—keeping your spine straight, chin lifted, and shoulders back—improves your overall health and self-confidence, and makes others perceive you as more attractive, too. [15] X Research source Get the perfect smile by practicing in the mirror and maintaining good dental hygiene. To improve your posture , think of elongating your spine when standing, and keep your shoulders relaxed and your feet flat on the floor when sitting.

steps.title: Thicker brows look more natural and youthful than thin brows.
steps.content: Thicker brows look more natural and youthful than thin brows. Grab some tweezers and pluck any stray hairs below your eyebrows. Use a pair of small brow scissors to snip away any unruly or long brow hairs above your brows, if needed. Finish off by applying a clear or tinted brow gel to help you shape your brows and keep them in check. [16] X Research source Use a clean mascara wand or spoolie to brush your eyebrows up and outward.

steps.title: Staying hydrated keeps your skin and hair looking great.
steps.content: Staying hydrated keeps your skin and hair looking great. Drinking loads of water may result in smoother skin and a healthier appearance overall. [17] X Research source Water is the best option because it’s free of calories and sugar, so try to make that your main beverage. Drinking other liquids, like juice and tea, and eating fresh fruits and vegetables can help with hydration, as well. [18] X Research source In general, men should aim to drink 15.5 cups (3.7 liters) of fluids daily, while women should aim for 11.5 cups (2.7 liters) of fluid daily. [19] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Teens should drink about 8 cups (2 liters) of fluid a day. [20] X Research source Reader Poll: We asked 379 wikiHow readers for their go-to strategy for staying hydrated during the day, and 61% of them said, always having a bottle of water on hand. [Take Poll]

steps.title: Exercise helps you maintain a healthy weight and boosts confidence.
steps.content: Exercise helps you maintain a healthy weight and boosts confidence. Even moderate-intensity aerobic activity, like biking and jogging, can help you stay fit and feel more attractive. Exercise also improves mood, so you’ll feel better about yourself. Plus, increasing your bone and muscle strength now will help to prevent injuries later in life. [21] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source If you’re not used to exercising, start slowly and build from there. You could try brisk walking a few times a week, then gradually increase the intensity after 2-3 weeks. In general, aim to get 150 minutes of moderate exercise a week, or 75 minutes of vigorous exercise a week. Moderate exercise includes biking, brisk walking, swimming, and mowing the lawn. Vigorous exercise includes running, heavy yard work, and aerobic dancing. [22] X Trustworthy Source Mayo Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Getting enough rest affects natural beauty in so many ways.
steps.content: Getting enough rest affects natural beauty in so many ways. When you're well-rested, your skin will look better, your eyes brighter and less puffy, and you'll feel more alert and energetic. With all of those benefits, it's no wonder they call it “beauty sleep.” [23] X Research source If you’re a teenager, aim for 8-10 hours of sleep each night. [24] X Trustworthy Source Centers for Disease Control and Prevention Main public health institute for the US, run by the Dept. of Health and Human Services Go to source Avoid consuming caffeine 6 hours before bedtime so you can fall asleep easily. [25] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Try keeping your bedroom cooler to improve your sleep quality. Tidy up your room and block out any light or excessive noise to create a good sleep environment .

steps.title: The smooth material is gentle on your skin and hair.
steps.content: The smooth material is gentle on your skin and hair. If you want to get a jump on natural-looking beauty each morning, sleep on a silk or satin pillowcase at night! Cotton pillowcases absorb more moisture than silk, and they may increase friction against your skin, leading to irritation, dryness, and premature wrinkling. [26] X Research source Sleeping on a silky surface also reduces friction that leads to frizzy hair, breakage, and tangles. [27] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source

steps.title: Nutrient-dense food helps you look healthy and youthful.
steps.content: Nutrient-dense food helps you look healthy and youthful. The best way to improve your skin health is to eat lots of fruit, veggies, whole grains, 1% or fat-free dairy, poultry, and fish. [28] X Research source Choose foods high in omega-3s, antioxidants, and phytonutrients to keep your cells hydrated and reduce free radicals in your body. This includes: walnuts, almonds, edamame, tomatoes, bell peppers, broccoli, strawberries, kiwi, citrus, grapes, tuna, and salmon. [29] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Eat 5-6 cups of bright colored veggies daily to reduce skin discoloration. [30] X Research source Aim to eat a diet filled with plant-based foods, and reduce your consumption of processed foods and alcohol. [31] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source

steps.title: Foods high in sugar and saturated fat can make your skin look dull.
steps.content: Foods high in sugar and saturated fat can make your skin look dull. Studies show that sugar, fried foods, saturated fats, simple carbs, and packaged foods damage your skin, cause inflammation, and can induce early-onset wrinkles. [32] X Trustworthy Source PubMed Central Journal archive from the U.S. National Institutes of Health Go to source Replacing those types of foods with ones that are rich in vitamins and minerals can help you maintain a healthy, youthful glow. [33] X Research source Healthy snack alternatives include frozen grapes, popcorn, veggies and hummus, yogurt and berries, chia pudding, apples with peanut butter, a handful of nuts, crackers with reduced fat cheese spread. [34] X Research source If you're having a hard time eating healthy, try replacing one meal a week with a healthier option. For instance, instead of toasting white bread made with enriched flour, choose a whole wheat option instead.

steps.title: Overwashing strips your hair of moisture, leaving it dry and brittle.
steps.content: Overwashing strips your hair of moisture, leaving it dry and brittle. Contrary to popular belief, some people don’t need to wash their hair every day! Wash your hair based on how often it gets oily or dirty. For most people, this is every 2-3 days. Gently massage a quarter-sized dollop of shampoo into your hair, focusing mainly on your scalp and roots. Then, rinse it out thoroughly with warm water. [35] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Make sure you use the right shampoo for your hair type. For example, if you have dry hair, use a moisturizing shampoo formulated for dry or damaged hair. If you have straight hair and an oily scalp, you may want to shampoo every day or use a dry shampoo to soak up excess oil in between washes. For dry, textured, curly, or thick hair, shampoo when needed. This could be once or twice a week.

steps.title: Conditioner keeps your hair healthy, hydrated, and shiny.
steps.content: Conditioner keeps your hair healthy, hydrated, and shiny. Massage conditioner into your hair from the midshaft to the ends, avoiding the roots. If you have fine or straight hair, apply conditioner to the ends only so you don’t weigh down your hair. Wait 2-3 minutes, then rinse your hair with lukewarm water. [36] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Choose the best conditioner for your hair type. [37] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source For example, if you’ve just dyed your hair, use a conditioner for color-treated hair . Apply a hair mask once or twice a week to hydrate and strengthen your hair. [38] X Research source

steps.title: When you do use them, lower the heat and use a heat protectant spray.
steps.content: When you do use them, lower the heat and use a heat protectant spray. Heat-styling tools like blow dryers, flat irons, and curling irons can cause damage, split ends, and dullness. Try to let your hair air dry as often as you can. [39] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source If you have to blow dry it, use the lowest heat setting and fit your dryer with a diffuser so the heat gets evenly distributed. [40] X Trustworthy Source Consumer Reports Nonprofit organization dedicated to consumer advocacy and product testing Go to source Other tips to prevent hair damage: [41] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Try to use heat styling tools once a week or less often. Apply a heat protectant spray before straightening or curling your hair. If you have straight hair, let your hair air dry a bit before combing it with a brush. If you have curly hair, brush your hair when it’s wet to minimize breakage.

steps.title: Dry brushing exfoliates your skin and increases blood circulation.
steps.content: Dry brushing exfoliates your skin and increases blood circulation. It also stimulates your nervous system and feels invigorating! Use a natural stiff-bristled dry brush with a long handle so you can reach your back. Start brushing at your ankles and work your way up with long, fluid strokes. Use gentle, circular motions on your torso and back. Then, hop in the shower to rinse away the dead skin cells and apply moisturizer. [42] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source You only need to go over the same area 1-2 times—overdoing it can irritate your skin. Dry brush once a week to start and gradually increase to a few times a week as your skin gets used to it. Never dry brush on skin that is broken, burned, sensitive, or infected. Stop dry brushing if your skin becomes irritated or inflamed. Use light pressure around sensitive areas, like your breasts and neck. Avoid dry brushing your face, since the skin is more sensitive than the rest of your body.

steps.title: Sun exposure can cause premature aging, lines, and wrinkles.
steps.content: Sun exposure can cause premature aging, lines, and wrinkles. Anytime you go outside, even on cloudy days, you're exposing your skin to damaging UV rays. You can prevent sun damage by applying a sunscreen with SPF 30 or higher, and reapplying it every 2 hours (or after swimming or sweating). [43] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source To protect your lips, use a SPF 30 lip balm before going outside. Don’t forget to apply sunscreen to your neck, ears, hands, the tops of your feet, and the top of your head!

steps.title: An even complexion and flushed cheeks will make you look healthier.
steps.content: An even complexion and flushed cheeks will make you look healthier. It’s all about choosing the right products and applying them with a light touch. Instead of using a full-coverage foundation, try a tinted moisturizer or serum instead. [44] X Research source Apply a tiny bit of concealer to hide any blemishes or dark spots. Then, swipe a cream blush over the apples of your cheeks for a natural, healthy glow.

steps.title: Curling your lashes makes them look longer and opens up your eyes.
steps.content: Curling your lashes makes them look longer and opens up your eyes. To look more naturally beautiful, curl your lashes with an eyelash curler . Apply a light coat of brown or black mascara to your top lashes to accentuate your eyes. You can also get a lash lift, where a technician will apply a solution to your individual lashes to semi-permanently curl them. [45] X Research source To get longer lashes , you can massage castor oil over your lashes before bedtime. [46] X Research source

steps.title: Scrub and moisturize your lips so they look full and juicy.
steps.content: Scrub and moisturize your lips so they look full and juicy. Research shows that lips contribute to the beauty of the face, with fuller lips increasing attractiveness in females. [47] X Trustworthy Source Nature Respected Multidisciplinary Scientific Journal Go to source Exfoliate your lips with a scrub , rinse off the product, then apply a hydrating lip balm to seal in moisture. [48] X Research source If you like, apply a tinted lip balm in a nude or rosy color. [49] X Research source

steps.title: Sleeping in makeup can cause breakouts, dullness, and premature aging.
steps.content: Sleeping in makeup can cause breakouts, dullness, and premature aging. Even if you’re super tired and ready to go to bed, don’t skip this! First, soak a cotton pad with an oil-free makeup remover and swipe the pad all over your face to remove your makeup. Then, follow up with your usual cleanser to get every last bit of makeup off your face. Your skin will thank you for it! [50] X Trustworthy Source American Academy of Dermatology Professional organization made of over 20,000 certified dermatologists Go to source Use micellar water to remove your makeup if you have sensitive skin. If you’re wearing waterproof makeup or sunscreen, double cleanse with a cleansing balm before going in with your normal cleanser. [51] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source Alternative: For an even deeper clean, try a double cleanse routine. Start with an oil-based cleanser to dissolve makeup, sunscreen, and excess oil on your skin. Follow up with a gentle water-based cleanser to wash away any remaining impurities. This two-step process can thoroughly cleanse the skin without stripping its natural moisture, leaving it refreshed and ready for the next steps in your skincare routine. [52] X Expert Source Barbie Ritzman Beauty & Skincare Specialist Expert Interview. 23 August 2021.

steps.title: Find clothes that accentuate your figure to boost your confidence.
steps.content: Find clothes that accentuate your figure to boost your confidence. Your style can instantly make you more attractive, especially if you know how to dress for your body type . [53] X Research source Choose clothes that bring you joy, and don’t be afraid to dress differently from other people. If you love a piece but it doesn’t fit right, you can always get it professionally tailored. If you don’t know what to wear, go for something simple like a black bodysuit , white singlet, or fitted t-shirt. [54] X Research source Accessories are an easy way to add more personality to an outfit. Experiment with various belts, earrings, necklaces, bracelets, and feel free to layer them for a maximalist look. If you want to look more feminine, wear a simple cubic zirconia pendant or diamond studs .

steps.title: Being confident in yourself will make you more beautiful.
steps.content: Being confident in yourself will make you more beautiful. Learning to love yourself is one of the most important steps in radiating beauty and confidence. If you speak to yourself negatively, it can make you feel unattractive, no matter how much effort you put into your looks. [55] X Research source Instead, focus on your strengths and accomplishments, and tell yourself that you’re worthy and loved every day. Other things you can do to boost your self-esteem include: Make time for activities that bring you joy. Take time to check in with yourself each day. Surround yourself with people who support you. Meditate, get a massage, or take a relaxing bath. Take risks and push yourself out of your comfort zone. Write down what you’re grateful for at the end of each day. Compare your progress to your past self and not to others.
